utilitarian 0.1.1

Package Related Functions

Source: vignettes/package-related.Rmd
package-related.Rmd
library(utilitarian)

usePackage

Don’t know if something is installed? Want your code to install packages when run if they’re absent? usePackage is here to help!

usePackage("dichromat")
#> Package dichromat not found, installing...
#> Installing package into 'C:/Users/AZetner/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmp4EYvzn/temp_libpath254c11ad3637'
#> (as 'lib' is unspecified)
#> package 'dichromat' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked
#> 
#> The downloaded binary packages are in
#>  C:\Users\AZetner\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpiOsD6Y\downloaded_packages
#> Loading Package dichromat...
#> Loading required package: dichromat

Combine usePackage() with the purrr package to attempt to attach and (install if unavailable) multiple packages. Walk doesn’t return an output, only the secondary effects. In this case, an attached package from each of those in the character vector.

purrr::walk(c("DT", "dplyr", "lubridate", "readr", "ggplot2", "ggridges", "viridis", "hrbrthemes", "forcats", "tidyr"), ~ usePackage(.x))
#> Loading Package DT...
#> Loading required package: DT
#> Loading Package dplyr...
#> Loading required package: dplyr
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
#> Loading Package lubridate...
#> Loading required package: lubridate
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'lubridate'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     date
#> Loading Package readr...
#> Loading required package: readr
#> Loading Package ggplot2...
#> Loading required package: ggplot2
#> Loading Package ggridges...
#> Loading required package: ggridges
#> Loading Package viridis...
#> Loading required package: viridis
#> Loading required package: viridisLite
#> Loading Package hrbrthemes...
#> Loading required package: hrbrthemes
#> Loading Package forcats...
#> Loading required package: forcats
#> Loading Package tidyr...
#> Loading required package: tidyr

libraries

Tired of quoting and typing in multiple library statements? No more!

Several flavours:

Silent and easy typing

Don’t bother with quotes. Just type your package names in and off you go.

libraries(dichromat, jsonlite)
sessionInfo()
#> R version 3.6.3 (2020-02-29)
#> Platform: x86_64-w64-mingw32/x64 (64-bit)
#> Running under: Windows 10 x64 (build 18363)
#> 
#> Matrix products: default
#> 
#> locale:
#> [1] LC_COLLATE=English_Canada.1252  LC_CTYPE=English_Canada.1252   
#> [3] LC_MONETARY=English_Canada.1252 LC_NUMERIC=C                   
#> [5] LC_TIME=English_Canada.1252    
#> 
#> attached base packages:
#> [1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base     
#> 
#> other attached packages:
#>  [1] jsonlite_1.6.1    tidyr_1.0.2       forcats_0.5.0     hrbrthemes_0.8.0 
#>  [5] viridis_0.5.1     viridisLite_0.3.0 ggridges_0.5.2    ggplot2_3.3.0    
#>  [9] readr_1.3.1       lubridate_1.7.4   dplyr_0.8.5       DT_0.13          
#> [13] dichromat_2.0-0   utilitarian_0.1.1
#> 
#> loaded via a namespace (and not attached):
#>  [1] tidyselect_1.0.0  xfun_0.12         purrr_0.3.3       colorspace_1.4-1 
#>  [5] vctrs_0.2.4       htmltools_0.4.0   yaml_2.2.1        rlang_0.4.5      
#>  [9] pkgdown_1.5.0     pillar_1.4.3      glue_1.3.2        withr_2.1.2      
#> [13] gdtools_0.2.1     lifecycle_0.2.0   plyr_1.8.6        stringr_1.4.0    
#> [17] munsell_0.5.0     gtable_0.3.0      htmlwidgets_1.5.1 memoise_1.1.0    
#> [21] evaluate_0.14     knitr_1.28        extrafont_0.17    fansi_0.4.1      
#> [25] Rttf2pt1_1.3.8    Rcpp_1.0.4        backports_1.1.5   scales_1.1.0     
#> [29] desc_1.2.0        fs_1.4.0          systemfonts_0.1.1 gridExtra_2.3    
#> [33] hms_0.5.3         digest_0.6.25     stringi_1.4.6     rprojroot_1.3-2  
#> [37] grid_3.6.3        cli_2.0.2         tools_3.6.3       magrittr_1.5

#> [45] MASS_7.3-51.5     ellipsis_0.3.0    assertthat_0.2.1  rmarkdown_2.1    
#> [49] rstudioapi_0.11   R6_2.4.1          compiler_3.6.3

Quoted

Like library() but better.

libraries("dichromat", "jsonlite", quoted = T)
sessionInfo()
#> R version 3.6.3 (2020-02-29)
#> Platform: x86_64-w64-mingw32/x64 (64-bit)
#> Running under: Windows 10 x64 (build 18363)
#> 
#> Matrix products: default
#> 
#> locale:
#> [1] LC_COLLATE=English_Canada.1252  LC_CTYPE=English_Canada.1252

Quoted in a Character Vector

Like library() but even better.

mypkgs  R version 3.6.3 (2020-02-29)
#> Platform: x86_64-w64-mingw32/x64 (64-bit)
#> Running under: Windows 10 x64 (build 18363)
#> 
#> Matrix products: default
#> 
#> locale:
#> [1] LC_COLLATE=English_Canada.1252  LC_CTYPE=English_Canada.1252   
#> [3] LC_MONETARY=English_Canada.1252 LC_NUMERIC=C                   
#> [5] LC_TIME=English_Canada.1252    
#> 
#> attached base packages:
#> [1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base     
#> 
#> other attached packages:
#>  [1] jsonlite_1.6.1    tidyr_1.0.2       forcats_0.5.0     hrbrthemes_0.8.0 
#>  [5] viridis_0.5.1     viridisLite_0.3.0 ggridges_0.5.2    ggplot2_3.3.0    
#>  [9] readr_1.3.1       lubridate_1.7.4   dplyr_0.8.5       DT_0.13

Unquote or Quoted but with Verbose Feedback

Because you like R to talk back.

libraries(dichromat, verbose = TRUE)
#> Attached packages: dichromat
